intro: Atractylis japonica, commonly known as Japanese Atractylis, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring rough, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets. Atractylis japonica is often found in moist meadows and forest margins, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional use in herbal medicine.
